etymology.description: 扫(掃) + 码(碼) = sweep/scan + code → scan a code.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to using a device (often a smartphone) to scan a QR code or barcode to get information or complete an action like payment. Common in digital check-ins, payments, and app logins.
etymology.simplification: Both characters are simplified: 掃 → 扫 (reduces the complex 帚 component) and 碼 → 码 (馬 → 马 under the 石 radical), lowering stroke count for faster writing.

parts.english: sweep; sweep away; scan; clean up

examples.chinese: 请在门口扫码登记(請在門口掃碼登記)。
examples.english: Please scan the code at the entrance to register.

examples.chinese: 我用手机扫码付款(我用手機掃碼付款)。
examples.english: I use my phone to scan the code to pay.

examples.chinese: 扫码即可领取优惠券(掃碼即可領取優惠券)。
examples.english: Scan the code to receive a coupon.
